cab.content: Military Secret./'*' I 1 From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India, .Ibth June 1919.( (Received 10th.)50109. 15tb June. 8094. No. 35.Part 1. J. No change Dakka front and north-west of Kabul river, except increase in Mohmand gangs reported Basawal and Closhta neighbourhood. These gangs under Chiknaur Nulla Uaji of Tararngzai and Mob(?)il, the three principal firebrands of this area, variously estimated from 2,000 to 5,000.2. Nadir Khan reported to have sent one battalion with two to four guns to frontier on Kaitu river, bearing advance by us there.3. Bannu, Derajat, Zhob quiet, except some unrest amongst Khetrans.4. Chamau reports increase of tents and men at Taknert hiil six miles north-west of Spin Baldak, also at Burgha Chaman and adjacent villages. An agent reports Abdul Qttdus to be intriguing with Achakzais, some of whom said to have joined Afghans and been issued with arms.5. No change Seistan and East Persian border.0. Maileson, 14th June, reports Askabad more cheerful. Trans-caspia cavalry holding Dushak Bolsheviks not yet able to bring up strong force owing to railway being a wreck.Part 2. Nil. Para. 2. Last half of 4 and 6 not communicated to Press.
